data.meta_description: Template:Infobox TV channel Nickelodeon (stylized as NICKELODEON and originally called Pinwheel) is one of the most successful and beloved American television networks and media brands aimed towards children ages 2-17 which airs Sundays-Thursdays from 5am-11pm and Fridays at 5am-Saturdays at...
data.text:
Template:Infobox TV channel Nickelodeon (stylized as NICKELODEON and originally called Pinwheel) is one of the most successful and beloved American television networks and media brands aimed towards children ages 2-17 which airs Sundays-Thursdays from 5am-11pm and Fridays at 5am-Saturdays at 12am. Although it was a 24-hour network for the entirety of 2009 as part of the many things Nickelodeon did for it's 30th anniversary which would continue until the end of 2011 which was the 20th anniversary of the brand name, Nicktoons.

To see updates and news on Nickelodeon4 as well as it's competition and allie companies, see Nick4 News

Radio[]

NickelRadio is Nickelodeon's radio station which airs on CBS's radio station weekends from 11am-10pm hosted by characters from various Nickelodeon series, weekdays from 10am-2pm as Nick Jr. Radio hosted by Noggin hosts, Moose A. Moose and Zee and weekdays from 3pm-7pm under NickelRadio with Stick Stickly hosting.

Mobile Apps[]

Nickelodeon released a free mobile app on April 2012 which consists of full episodes, games, videos as well as Nicktropolis just like in Nick.com.

Nickelodeon Studios[]

Nickelodeon Studios is an attraction at Universal Orlando Resort which is where they film most of their live-action series as well as have rides and attractions based on various Nickelodeon programs and the real headquarters for Nickelodeon and where they do/make everything. Besides, the Studio Tour, the Slime Geyser and the 1992-2042 Time Capsule, other attractions include: Template:Col-begin Template:Col-2
